text: eighty three-year-old Rana Khanna is
believed to be the longest-serving
flight attendant in the United States in
1949 United looking for some stewards I
showed up for along with 400 other
applicants and we applied for a
positions thought I'll never get this
job it's 400 other guys half of them had
coats and thighs all I had was an Aloha
shirt my name is Ron Akana
and I been with the United for 63 years
I'm number one in seniority and United
and I enjoy it
I've flown probably in excess of ten to
15 million miles this was the uniform
that we first had this is me up in this
corner here he was one of the first male
stewards to work the state-of-the-art
Boeing strata cruiser which was built in
the 1940s and featured a bar on the
lower deck I've had many of the
Hollywood people on board I brought the
whole cast of From Here to Eternity Burt
Lancaster Frank Sinatra Montgomery just
got a real big family 15 of them Burt
Lancaster had 12 or 13 martinis then
came and Bart ended with me as if he
hadn't had one I mean this guy was tough
not you know genuine tough guy I think
seniority in the airlines gives flight
attendants the power to choose their
schedules these days mr. okona chooses
to fly the Denver Hawaii route which
gives him a chance to visit his
childhood home a decade ago
he was among the highest paid flight
attendants at United earning a hundred
and six thousand dollars a year in
salary pension and Social Security he
jokes that floor
is how he earns his vacation money and
he's not quite ready to give up working
but he has started to consider
retirement Aloha means hello goodbye I
love you so in this case it's goodbye
and we're gonna miss him
we're gonna miss him it makes me stop
rock
